intro: Hiraea schizoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hiraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
